intro: Epilobium minutum var. foliosum, commonly known as narrowleaf willowherb, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features slender, hairy stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five pinkish to reddish petals, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges.
